TextView.android:text: Who are the Persons not authorized to engage in commercial activities?

According to Article 02 of Law No. 13-06 of July 23, 2013, amending and supplementing Article 08 of Law No. 04-08 of 14/8/2004, individuals convicted and not rehabilitated for crimes and offenses related to movements of capital to and from abroad, production and/or marketing of counterfeit products intended for consumption, bankruptcy, corruption, counterfeiting and/or infringement of copyright and neighboring rights, and drug trafficking cannot register or engage in commercial activities without obtaining a rehabilitation certificate.
What are the conditions related to commercial activity?

In this regard, a distinction should be made between regulated and non-regulated activities. Non-regulated activities: Open to all applicants who meet the general conditions related to the quality of a merchant. Regulated activities: Require prior authorization from the competent authorities. According to the provisions of Article 25 of Law 04-08 of 14/08/2004, amended and supplemented, approvals or provisional authorizations are acceptable for registration in the trade register for the exercise of a regulated activity.
What are the conditions related to the location of commercial activity?

The trade register for the exercise of a sedentary activity is issued to any individual or legal entity that justifies its legal establishment by owning or leasing a commercial space. However, according to Article 21 of Law 04-08 of August 14, 2004, amended and supplemented, when the individual is a first-time investor, they can establish their residence until the completion of the project. In this case, the domicile is that of the business site. Commercial companies without a registered office can domicile, for a maximum period of two years renewable once, with: A statutory auditor or an accountant. A lawyer or a notary. The residence of the legal representative of the company. At the start of the activity, the domicile becomes that of the company's business site.
What are the conditions related to individuals?

Individuals: Must enjoy their legal capacity and civil rights. Legal entities: Can take various forms, including commercial companies (general partnership, limited partnership, limited liability company, sole proprietorship), industrial and commercial public enterprises, associations, foreign companies operating in Algeria, and for-profit cooperatives.
